title: How to Get the URL for Any Image

steps.title: Open Google Images on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open Google Images on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. You can do so by going to https://images.google.com in a web browser like Chrome or Safari. If you don't have the Google Chrome app, you can download it for free from either the iPhone's App Store or the Android's Google Play Store .

steps.title: Search for an image.
steps.content: Search for an image. Type in a word or a phrase that describes the image you're looking for, then tap Go , Search , or Enter/Return . This will search Google for results matching your word or phrase.

steps.title: Tap a picture to open a larger version.
steps.content: Tap a picture to open a larger version. Scroll through the results until you find a photo that matches your search, then tap the one you want to copy.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu above the image ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu above the image ⋮ . You'll see it above the image's top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . Doing so brings up a list of options.

steps.title: Copy the link.
steps.content: Copy the link. The option varies depending on your browser. If you're using Chrome on Android, tap Copy link . On an iPhone or iPad with Chrome or Safari, tap Copy.

steps.title: Paste the link.
steps.content: Paste the link. To see the URL for your picture, open any app with a text field, tap the text field, tap and hold the text field for a moment, and tap Paste in the resulting menu.

steps.title: Open the Google Image search page.
steps.content: Open the Google Image search page. Go to https://images.google.com/ in your computer's web browser . This will open the Google search page for images.

steps.title: Enter an image search query and click the Search icon .
steps.content: Enter an image search query and click the Search icon . Doing so will search Google for images related to your search.

steps.title: Click an image.
steps.content: Click an image. Scroll through the results until you find one that matches your needs, then click it to view a larger version.

steps.title: Copy the image's URL.
steps.content: Copy the image's URL. Right-click or ctrl-click the image, then click one of the following depending on your browser: [1] X Research source Chrome - Click Copy image address Safari - Click Copy Image Address Microsoft Edge - Click Copy image link Firefox - Click Copy Image Link

steps.title: Paste the URL.
steps.content: Paste the URL. To see the URL for your picture, paste it into a text box, document, or message by clicking the desired location and pressing Ctrl + V (PC) or ⌘ Command + V (Mac).

steps.title: Find the picture for which you want to get the address.
steps.content: Find the picture for which you want to get the address. You can get the address for most images you find online.

steps.title: Make sure you're viewing the original version of the image.
steps.content: Make sure you're viewing the original version of the image. Some websites will display a thumbnail instead of the whole image. If you get the URL now, you'll only be getting the URL for the thumbnail. Make sure the full-size image is loaded in your browser. For example, the images in this wikiHow article are actually thumbnails. To see the full-size version, you'd need to click the image to open the full-size version in a new window.

steps.title: Right-click or control-click the image.
steps.content: Right-click or control-click the image. This will prompt a menu to appear On a mobile platform (e.g., a smartphone or a tablet), you can instead tap-and-hold the image and then tap the Copy URL or Copy Link menu option. Not all browsers will have this option.

steps.title: Copy the image's URL.
steps.content: Copy the image's URL. You'll click one of the following options in the drop-down menu depending on your browser: Chrome - Click Copy image address Safari - Click Copy Image Address Microsoft Edge - Click Copy image link Firefox' - Click Copy Image Link

steps.title: Paste the image URL.
steps.content: Paste the image URL. Once you've copied the image URL, it will be copied to your clipboard. You can then paste it anywhere you'd like, such as a message, document, or a browser's address bar. Just right-click, control-click, or long-press the typing area and select Paste .

steps.title: Open Imgur in a web browser.
steps.content: Open Imgur in a web browser. If you want to assign a URL to a picture from your computer, upload it to a file-hosting site like Imgur and then copy its link. Go to https://imgur.com/ in your web browser to get started.

steps.title: Click New post.
steps.content: Click New post . It's a green button at the top of the page. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Choose Photo/Video.
steps.content: Click Choose Photo/Video . Clicking it opens File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) on your computer.

steps.title: Select an image from your computer and click Open.
steps.content: Select an image from your computer and click Open . Go to the location of the image you want to upload, then click it to select it. Doing so uploads the selected picture to Imgur. You can give your image a title by clicking the text box directly above the image and typing in a title.

steps.title: Copy the image URL.
steps.content: Copy the image URL. You have two options: If you want a simple URL to share with others that will bring them directly to the image, click Grab Link to the right of the picture, then click Copy Link . If you need the raw image URL to embed in a blog or forum post, right-click or control-click the image and select Copy image address or Copy image link .

steps.title: Paste your image's URL.
steps.content: Paste your image's URL. To see the URL for your picture, paste it into a text box or text application by placing your cursor in the text box and pressing either Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ Command + V (Mac).
